provisions: This bill:  requires a third party that contracts with an LEA to provide a good to disclose to the LEA whether the good contains certain chemicals.

longTitle: This bill creates obligations and liabilities for a commercial entity that provides pornography or other materials harmful to minors.
subjectList: Internet Protocols, Pornography, Social Media
provisions: This bill:  provides definitions;  requires a commercial entity that provides pornography and other materials defined as being harmful to minors as a substantial portion of the entity's content to verify the age of individuals accessing the material;  establishes requirements and liability for retention of data;  imposes liability for publishers and distributors of material harmful to minors who fail to comply with verification requirements; and  provides that an Internet service provider or hosting entity is not liable for hosting or transmitting material harmful to minors to the extent that it is not the creator of the material.

longTitle: This bill creates the Utility Bill Assistance Program (program).
actionCodeDesc: Senate/ received enrolled bill from Printing
subjectList: Energy, Grant Programs and Incentives
monies: This bill appropriates in fiscal year 2023:  to Public Utility Restricted Account as a one-time appropriation:  from Nonlapsing Balances -- Department of Commerce -- Commerce General Regulation, One-time, $4,700,000;  to Public Utility Restricted Account as a one-time appropriation:  from Nonlapsing Balances -- Department of Commerce -- Public Utilities Professional and Technical Services, One-time, $2,400,000;  to Public Utility Restricted Account as a one-time appropriation:  from Nonlapsing Balances -- Department of Commerce -- Office of Consumer Services Professional and Technical Services, One-time, $4,200,000;  to Public Utility Restricted Account as a one-time appropriation:  from Nonlapsing Balances -- Public Service Commission, One-time, $867,000; and  to Department of Commerce -- Utility Bill Assistance Program:  from General Fund Restricted -- Public Utility Restricted Account, One-time, $12,167,000.
provisions: This bill:  creates the program which is to be administered by the Division of Public Utilities (division);  authorizes the division to disburse money allocated to the program to large-scale electricity and natural gas utility companies to provide bill credits for customers who meet income requirements;  requires a large-scale utility company to obtain approval from the Public Service Commission to participate in the program and to report to the Public Service Commission on the program's use; and  requires the division to report to the Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Interim Committee on the status of the program.

shortTitle: Point of the Mountain State Land Authority Amendments
longTitle: This bill modifies provisions relating to the Point of the Mountain State Land Authority.
subjectList: Local Governments, Local Governments, Local Governments, Economic Development, Local Government Boundaries, Local Government Boundaries, Local Government Boundaries, Political Subdivisions (Local Issues), Department of Government Operations, Department of Government Operations, Department of Government Operations, Boards and Committees, Boards and Committees, Boards and Committees, Government Operations (State Issues), Government Operations (State Issues), Government Operations (State Issues), Sales and Use Tax, Sales and Use Tax, Sales and Use Tax, Facilities, Construction, and Management, Facilities, Construction, and Management, Facilities, Construction, and Management
provisions: This bill:  provides that the Point of the Mountain State Land Authority has control over the management, development, and disposition of point of the mountain state land;  provides for the role of the Division of Facilities Construction and Management with respect to construction on point of the mountain state land;  specifies that local governments do not have zoning authority with respect to the point of the mountain state land;  eliminates a limitation on the Authority's ability to spend Authority money;  authorizes the Authority to impose an accommodations tax and specifies that the revenue from the tax is to be used for affordable housing;  modifies the composition of the Authority board;  authorizes the Authority board to hold a closed meeting for a specified purpose; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

longTitle: This bill amends provisions related to the juvenile court.
subjectList: Juveniles, Abuse, Neglect, or Dependency, Judicial Administration, Courts, Immigration, Judicial Operations, Juvenile Justice, Juvenile Justice Services
provisions: This bill:  amends the original jurisdiction of the juvenile court;  allows for the juvenile court to enter an order with special findings regarding the abuse, neglect, or dependence of a noncitizen child; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill amends the Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Election Law, Voting and Voter Registration, Government Operations (State Issues), Election Administration
provisions: This bill:  authorizes the use of instant runoff voting for only a nonpartisan municipal primary election;  prohibits the use of instant runoff voting for a municipal general election related to that primary election; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill amends the process for feasibility studies when creating a new school district.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Education, K-12 Education, School Districts
provisions: This bill:  amends provisions for creating a new school district;  requires the state auditor to conduct a feasibility study under certain circumstances; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

longTitle: This bill amends provisions related to expungement.
subjectList: Government Records, Courts, Criminal Procedure, Crimes, Judicial Operations, Expungement
provisions: This bill:  amends the requirements for a certificate of eligibility to expunge records of arrest, investigation, and detention;  amends the requirements for a certificate of eligibility to expunge records of a conviction;  amends the requirements for a petition for expungement for a traffic offense case;  addresses a victim's response to a petition for expungement; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill modifies the time period for refunding a taxpayer following an appeal.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Income Tax, Property Tax, Revenue and Taxation
provisions: This bill:  extends the period of time in which the state or a taxing entity has to pay a taxpayer that receives a reduction in the amount of taxes owed following an appeal.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill enacts the Dedicated Infrastructure District Act.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Counties, Business, Construction, Education, Electricity, Energy, Land Use, Housing, Local Government Boundaries, Limited Purpose Local Government Entities, Political Subdivisions (Local Issues), Government Operations (State Issues), Property Tax, Property Tax Collection, Revenue and Taxation, Constitutional Officers, Incorporation, Lieutenant Governor, Local Government Infrastructure and Utilities, Planning and Zoning, Unincorporated Areas, Public Infrastructure District
provisions: This bill:  enacts the Dedicated Infrastructure District Act;  defines terms;  establishes objectives and requirements for the creation of a dedicated infrastructure district to finance the costs of certain infrastructure and improvements;  provides for the membership of the board of trustees of a dedicated infrastructure district;  establishes requirements for the charter governing a dedicated infrastructure district;  requires a dedicated infrastructure district to engage certain professional support;  allows a dedicated infrastructure district to issue bonds and levy taxes with certain limitations;  allows an individual to contest a tax or fee imposed by a dedicated infrastructure district or to contest the creation of a dedicated infrastructure district; and  makes technical changes.

shortTitle: Performance Reporting and Efficiency Process Amendments
longTitle: This bill modifies the government performance reporting and efficiency process.
actionCodeDesc: Senate/ received enrolled bill from Printing
subjectList: Public Funds and Accounts, Government Operations (State Issues)
provisions: This bill:  increases the threshold for a funding item that requires a performance measure;  requires the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget and the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst to compile and provide to executive agencies a list of funding items passed each session;  clarifies the process for finalizing an executive agency's proposed performance measures;  modifies the requirements of the efficiency improvement process;  clarifies the role of the legislative auditor general in the review and response to an efficiency evaluation; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Revenue Bond and Capital Facilities Amendments
longTitle: This bill amends and enacts provisions relating to revenue bonds and funding for certain capital facility design and construction projects.
subjectList: Public Bonds, Business, Education, Higher Education, Alcohol, Revenue and Taxation
provisions: This bill:  addresses the use of money appropriated to the State Store Land Acquisition and Building Construction Fund; and  expresses the Legislature's intent relating to the Utah Board of Higher Education's issuance, sale, and delivery of revenue bonds to finance the construction of:  the West Village Family and Graduate Housing Phase Two at the University of Utah;  the Undergraduate Student Housing project at the University of Utah;  the South Campus Garage at the University of Utah;  the John and Marcia Price Computing and Engineering project at the University of Utah;  the South Campus Residence Hall at Utah State University; and  the South Campus Parking Terrace project at Utah State University.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill modifies provisions regarding local district processes, the annexation of areas for special service districts, and the Open and Public Meetings Act.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Local Districts, Political Subdivisions (Local Issues)
provisions: This bill:  amends the time requirement for notices and hearings of impact fee resolution from 14 to 10 days;  amends the election procedures for a local district board;  modifies the process for local district boundary changes;  modifies the fee collection and payment process for local districts;  provides that an annexed area for a special service district is subject to the user fees imposed and property taxes levied for the benefit of the special service district once the required documents are recorded; and  makes technical changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill amends and enacts provisions related to reproductive health data.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Electronic Privacy, Technology, Public Utilities and Technology, Abortion, Health and Human Services, Health Care, Medical Records, Data and Cyber Security, Telehealth
provisions: This bill:  amends the Utah Consumer Privacy Act (act) to make reproductive health data subject to the provisions of the act;  enacts provisions prohibiting government entities from, in the course of an investigation into a potential violation of or prosecution of state law, seeking or using reproductive health data, except with the consent of the consumer;  defines terms; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill addresses regulation of local food.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Agriculture & Food, Food
provisions: This bill:  defines terms;  addresses the imposition of restrictions on local food during an emergency; and  addresses rulemaking authority.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Supporting the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act
longTitle: This resolution recognizes the benefits from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (the Act) and encourages the United States Congress to permanently extend the Act.
subjectList: Resolutions, Revenue and Taxation
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes the various positive economic benefits to individual and corporate taxpayers due to the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017;  examines the consequences of the expiration of the Act in 2025; and  encourages Congress to permanently extend the Act to retain the economic benefits to taxpayers.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Regarding the Environmental Impact of Vehicle Idling
longTitle: This resolution encourages Utahns, businesses, and other entities to take steps to reduce idling.
subjectList: Resolutions, Air Quality, Emissions Control, Environment, Motor Vehicles, Transportation
provisions: This resolution:  provides data on fuel expended idling compared with restarting an engine;  encourages Utahns to turn off their engines, especially in areas where sensitive populations congregate; and  encourages certain businesses, organizations, and entities to place signs educating drivers on the fuel savings of restarting an engine instead of idling.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Encouraging Support for the Listen and Explain, Cooperate and Communicate Campaign
longTitle: This resolution supports the creation of the Listen and Explain, Cooperate and Communicate Campaign.
subjectList: Resolutions, Peace Officers, Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice
provisions: This resolution:  highlights the importance of a relationship of trust between law enforcement and the community members they serve;  details what elements must be in place to strengthen the relationship between law enforcement and community members; and  supports the creation of the Listen and Explain, Cooperate and Communicate Campaign.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Encouraging Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Awareness and Screening
longTitle: This resolution encourages the promotion of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy awareness and screening.
subjectList: Health Insurance, Insurance, Resolutions, Business, Education, Disease Control and Prevention, Health and Human Services, Health Care, Health Care Professionals, Legislative Operations, Government Operations (State Issues), Department of Health and Human Services, Local Health Departments, State Symbols and Designations, Constitutional Officers, Governor, Public Health
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes undiagnosed and untreated hypertrophic cardiomyopathy as a significant public health issue; and  encourages healthcare providers, public health departments, health insurers, employers, education institutions, the media, and others to promote awareness of the disease and encourage individuals to seek appropriate screening from qualified healthcare professionals.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Concerning the Celebration of Halloween
longTitle: This resolution encourages Utah communities to celebrate Halloween on the same day each year.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, State Symbols and Designations
provisions: This resolution:  acknowledges the history and festivities surrounding the annual celebration of Halloween; and  encourages Utah communities to celebrate Halloween on the last Friday in October each year.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Regarding the Great Salt Lake Elevation Targets
longTitle: This resolution addresses the Great Salt Lake.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Natural Resources, Legislative Operations, Water
provisions: This resolution:  describes the current status of the Great Salt Lake;   addresses the impacts of the Great Salt Lake on the state's economy;  discusses the impacts of low lake levels; and  recommends the adoption of a goal to devise and implement policies, incentives, and funding sources to return the Great Salt Lake to optimal levels.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Concerning the Northern Utah Veterans Cemetery Grant Submission
longTitle: This resolution encourages the Utah Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to submit a grant application for assistance in the construction of a new veterans cemetery.
subjectList: Resolutions, Cemeteries, Veterans Affairs, Veterans and Military Affairs, Department of Veterans and Military Affairs
provisions: This resolution:  honors all who have served in the United States Armed Forces;  recognizes that many of Utah's veterans live north of Salt Lake County; and  encourages and supports the submission of a grant application to the Veterans Cemetery Grant Program.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Promoting Kindness in Utah
longTitle: This resolution expresses recognition of, and support for, kindness throughout the state of Utah.
subjectList: Resolutions
provisions: This resolution:  emphasizes the importance of kindness in Utah;  recognizes Utah citizen's inherent proclivity to be kind to their fellow citizens; and  urges continued support for proactive acts of kindness to foster a healthier society for our citizens.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Opposing Efforts to Weaken the Economy or Restrict Energy Supply
longTitle: This resolution supports the treasurer and government entities in opposing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investing.
subjectList: Resolutions, Energy, Public Utilities and Technology
provisions: This resolution:  highlights how ESG investing harms consumers and investors;  supports the state treasurer, attorney general, state auditor, and state agencies in opposing ESG investing;  identifies the coordinated pressure campaigns from financial institutions and regulatory bodies; and  calls upon Utah to defend consumers and investors from the harms of ESG investing.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Revenue and Taxation
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify provisions relating to property tax and real estate.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Resolutions, Resolutions, Rules, Resolutions, Rules, Utah Constitutional Amendments, Political Subdivisions (Local Issues), Political Subdivisions (Local Issues), Property Tax, Property Tax, Revenue and Taxation, Real Property, Real Property
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  require that 45% of the fair market value of residential property be exempt from property tax;  permit the exemption of greater than 45% of the fair market value of residential property to be exempt from property tax; and  prohibit the State, or a political subdivision of the State, from imposing a tax on the transfer of real property.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Appointing Victoria Stirling Ashby as General Counsel
longTitle: This resolution approves the appointment of Victoria Stirling Ashby as the Legislative General Counsel.
subjectList: Legislative Operations, Legislative Organization, Legislative Employees and Compensation, Legislative Staff Offices
provisions: This resolution:  approves the appointment of Victoria Stirling Ashby as Legislative General Counsel for a six-year term.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Property Tax Exemptions
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify a provision relating to property tax exemptions.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Utah Constitutional Amendments, Property Tax
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  authorize the creation in statute of a property tax exemption for privately owned real property that is used to support public education, children, or individuals with a disability.

shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - Fiscal Note Deadlines
longTitle: This resolution modifies the fiscal note deadline for certain legislation.
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Legislative Operations
provisions: This resolution:  provides an exception to the fiscal note deadline for legislation that affects public retirement benefits and requires an actuarial analysis to prepare the fiscal note.

shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - Budgeting Changes to State Retirement Contributions
longTitle: This resolution modifies duties of the Executive Appropriations Committee related to retirement contributions.
subjectList: Public Employees Retirement, Utah Retirement Systems (URS)
provisions: This resolution:  directs the Executive Appropriations Committee to set aside any savings from each reduction in the amortization rate and, when the total set aside money reaches a specified threshold, include the amount in the base budget as an increase to benefitted state employee salaries.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Amending Rules of Procedure and Evidence Regarding Criminal Prosecutions
longTitle: This joint resolution amends court rules of procedure and evidence regarding criminal prosecutions.
subjectList: Courts, Courts, Courts, Criminal Procedure, Criminal Procedure, Criminal Procedure, Judicial Operations, Judicial Operations, Judicial Operations, Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice, Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice, Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice, Victims, Victims, Victims
provisions: This joint resolution:  amends Rule 7B of the Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure to address the use of reliable hearsay and the admission of evidence in preliminary hearings;  amends Rule 14 of the Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure to address a defendant's right to a discovery deposition in a criminal prosecution;  amends Rule 16 of the Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure to allow for depositions for the purpose of discovery in a criminal prosecution;  amends Rule 22 of the Utah Rules of Juvenile Procedure to address the use of reliable hearsay in preliminary hearings;  amends Rule 1102 of the Utah Rules of Evidence to address the admission of reliable hearsay statements in preliminary hearings; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Approving Settlement Agreement with the United States
longTitle: This resolution approves a proposed settlement agreement.
subjectList: Resolutions, Judicial Operations
provisions: This resolution:  approves the proposed settlement agreement related to the United States' claims against the state of Utah in United States, ex. rel. Williams, v. State of Utah, et. al., United States District Court, District of Utah, Case No. 2:15-cv-00054.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - International Relations and Trade Committee
longTitle: This resolution modifies provisions related to the International Relations and Trade Committee.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Resolutions, Rules, International Trade
provisions: This resolution:  removes the repeal date that applies to the International Relations and Trade Committee.

shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - Amendments to Joint Rules
longTitle: This resolution modifies joint legislative rules.
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Legislative Organization
provisions: This resolution:  modifies references to Senate and House staff;  modifies the permissible effective dates for legislation;  provides that a nonbinding joint resolution converts to a Senate resolution or a House resolution, if the resolution passes the originating house but fails to pass the opposite house;  clarifies a legislator's authority to request legislation when the legislator fails to win reelection;  addresses the process by which on the 11th day of the annual general session the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel makes public the short title of each request for legislation;  modifies the definition of "authorized legislative committee"; and  makes corrections to joint legislative rules, including eliminating obsolete language and clarifying existing requirements.

shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Income Tax
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify provisions related to the use of intangible property tax and income tax.
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Education, K-12 Education, Higher Education, Utah Constitutional Amendments, Corporate Tax, Income Tax, Individual Income Tax
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  removes restrictions on the use of intangible property tax and income tax.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Approving Zhifan Dong Proposed Settlement Agreement
longTitle: This resolution approves a settlement agreement to resolve claims against the state, the University of Utah, and individual employees of the University of Utah.
subjectList: Resolutions, Resolutions, Rules, Judicial Operations
provisions: This resolution:  approves a settlement agreement for claims related to the death of Zhifan Dong.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Senate Resolution Supporting Washington D.C. Statehood
longTitle: This resolution proclaims the Senate of the state of Utah supports admitting Washington, D.C. into the Union as a state of the United States of America.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Resolutions, Rules
provisions: This resolution:  proclaims that the Senate of the state of Utah supports admitting Washington, D.C. into the Union as a state of the United States of America; and  urges the members of the United States Congress to enact federal legislation granting statehood to the people of Washington, D.C.

shortTitle: Senate Rules Resolution - Senate Committee Security
longTitle: This resolution enacts Senate rules related to conduct at a Senate committee meeting.
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Legislative Operations

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Senate Rules Resolution - Public Hearing for Committee Bills
longTitle: This Senate rules resolution addresses Senate standing committee consideration of committee bills.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Legislative Operations
provisions: This resolution:  requires the Senate Rules Committee to refer legislation to a standing committee regardless of whether the legislation is a committee bill;  removes obsolete language related to the Occupational and Professional Licensure Review Committee; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Senate Rules Resolution - Amendments to Senate Rules
longTitle: This resolution modifies legislative rules governing the Senate.
subjectList: Resolutions, Rules, Legislative Operations
